    • Class soc.game.SOCInventory extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2000L

      • Serialized Fields

        • news

          java.util.List<E> news
          Current set of the items having 1 of 3 possible states (New and not playable yet; Playable; Kept until end of game). If an item's type has SOCDevCard.isVPCard(ctype) it is placed in kept, never in news.

          This implementation assumes players will have only a few cards or items at a time, so linear searching for a SOCInventoryItem.itype type is acceptable.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • playables

          java.util.List<E> playables
          Current set of the items having 1 of 3 possible states (New and not playable yet; Playable; Kept until end of game). If an item's type has SOCDevCard.isVPCard(ctype) it is placed in kept, never in news.

          This implementation assumes players will have only a few cards or items at a time, so linear searching for a SOCInventoryItem.itype type is acceptable.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • kept

          java.util.List<E> kept
          Current set of the items having 1 of 3 possible states (New and not playable yet; Playable; Kept until end of game). If an item's type has SOCDevCard.isVPCard(ctype) it is placed in kept, never in news.

          This implementation assumes players will have only a few cards or items at a time, so linear searching for a SOCInventoryItem.itype type is acceptable.

          Since:
          2.0.00

    • Class soc.game.SOCInventoryItem extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2000L

      • Serialized Fields

        • itype

          int itype
          This inventory item's identifying type code or Dev Card type, which may be used at client and server and sent over the network to specify this particular kind of item in a game.

          For dev cards, it would be SOCDevCardConstants.KNIGHT, SOCDevCardConstants.DISC, etc. The type code for items which aren't dev cards should be unique within the game scenario being played, not just unique within its java class, and not overlap with the dev card constants. For a port being moved in scenario _SC_FTRI, it would be negative: -SOCBoard.MISC_PORT, -SOCBoard.SHEEP_PORT, etc.

        • playable

          boolean playable
          Is this item playable this turn (state PLAYABLE), not newly given (NEW_GAME)?

        • kept

          boolean kept
          Is this item to be kept in hand until end of game (never state NEW_GAME)?

          Items with this flag can either be SOCInventoryItem.isPlayable() before keeping, or not. When the item is added to inventory, SOCInventoryItem.isPlayable() is checked before SOCInventoryItem.isKept() to determine the item's initial state.

          See Also:
          SOCInventoryItem.isVPItem()

        • vpItem

          boolean vpItem
          Is this item worth Victory Points when kept in inventory?

        • canCancelPlay

          boolean canCancelPlay
          While this item is being played or placed on the board, can placement be canceled? (Not all items can be played or placed.) The canceled item is returned to the player's inventory to be played later.

        • strKey

          java.lang.String strKey
          i18n string key for this type of item, to be resolved by SOCStringManager to something like "Market (1VP)"

        • aStrKey

          java.lang.String aStrKey
          i18n string key for an item of this type, to be resolved by SOCStringManager to something like "a Market (+1VP)"

    • Class soc.game.SOCPlayer extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2450L

      • Serialized Fields

        • name

          java.lang.String name
          the name of the player

        • playerNumber

          int playerNumber
          The integer id for this player (0 to n-1).

        • game

          SOCGame game
          The game that this player is in; not null until SOCPlayer.destroyPlayer() is called.

        • numPieces

          int[] numPieces
          The number of pieces not in play, available to build. Indexes are SOCPlayingPiece constants: SOCPlayingPiece.ROAD, SOCPlayingPiece.SETTLEMENT, SOCPlayingPiece.CITY, SOCPlayingPiece.SHIP. Initially SOCPlayer.ROAD_COUNT, SOCPlayer.SETTLEMENT_COUNT, etc.

        • numWarships

          int numWarships
          For scenario option _SC_PIRI, the number of SOCShips that are converted to warships. See SOCPlayer.getNumWarships() for details.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • pieces

          java.util.Vector<E> pieces
          a list of this player's pieces in play (does not include any SOCPlayer.fortress).
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.getPieces()

        • roadsAndShips

          java.util.Vector<E> roadsAndShips
          a list of this player's roads and ships in play. Although roads and ships are kept together here, in SOCPlayer.numPieces[] they're counted separately.

          Before v2.0.00 this field was roads.

          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.getRoadOrShip(int), SOCPlayer.roadNodes

        • settlements

          java.util.Vector<E> settlements
          a list of this player's settlements in play

        • cities

          java.util.Vector<E> cities
          a list of this player's cities in play

        • fortress

          SOCFortress fortress
          For scenario option _SC_PIRI, the "pirate fortress" that this player must defeat to win. The player's warships are used to defeat the fortress; see SOCPlayer.getNumWarships(). Null if fortress has been defeated and converted to a settlement. Null unless game has that scenario option.

          There is no setFortress method; use putPiece. For details see SOCPlayer.getFortress().

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • spItems

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> spItems
          Player's SOCSpecialItems, if any, by type. See getter/setter javadocs for details on type keys and rationale for lack of synchronization. ArrayList is used to guarantee we can store null items.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • lastSettlementCoord

          int lastSettlementCoord
          The node coordinate of our most recent settlement placement. Useful during initial placement.

        • lastRoadCoord

          int lastRoadCoord
          The edge coordinate of our most recent road or ship. Useful during initial placement.

        • longestRoadLength

          int longestRoadLength
          length of the longest road for this player

        • lrPaths

          java.util.Vector<E> lrPaths
          List of longest road / longest trade-route paths. Is empty (not null) if SOCGameOptionSet.K_SC_0RVP is set.

        • resources

          SOCResourceSet resources
          how many of each resource this player has

        • rolledResources

          SOCResourceSet rolledResources
          Resources gained from dice roll of the current turn. Set in SOCPlayer.addRolledResources(SOCResourceSet), cleared in SOCPlayer.updateAtTurn().
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • lastActionBankTrade_give

          SOCResourceSet lastActionBankTrade_give
          For use at server by SOCGame, if the player's previous action this turn was a bank trade, the resources involved. Used to decide if they can undo the trade.

          Ignore unless SOCGame.canUndoBankTrade( ResourceSet, ResourceSet) is true.

          Since:
          1.1.13

        • lastActionBankTrade_get

          SOCResourceSet lastActionBankTrade_get
          For use at server by SOCGame, if the player's previous action this turn was a bank trade, the resources involved. Used to decide if they can undo the trade.

          Ignore unless SOCGame.canUndoBankTrade( ResourceSet, ResourceSet) is true.

          Since:
          1.1.13

        • forcedEndTurnCount

          int forcedEndTurnCount
          For use at server, this player's count of forced end turns this game. Useful for keeping track of buggy/slow ("stubborn") robots. Is incremented by SOCPlayer.addForcedEndTurn() and reset to 0 by SOCPlayer.setName(String).
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.isStubbornRobot()

        • resourceStats

          int[] resourceStats
          server-only total count of how many of each known resource the player has received this game from dice rolls. The used indexes are SOCResourceConstants.CLAY - SOCResourceConstants.WOOD, and also (in v2.0.00+) SOCResourceConstants.GOLD_LOCAL. See SOCPlayer.getResourceRollStats() for details.
          Since:
          1.1.09

        • inventory

          SOCInventory inventory
          The development cards this player holds, along with occasional scenario-specific items.

        • numKnights

          int numKnights
          how many knights this player has in play

        • devCardsPlayed

          java.util.List<E> devCardsPlayed
          Development cards played this game by this player, or null if none, at server: See SOCPlayer.getDevCardsPlayed() for details.
          Since:
          2.4.50

        • numRBCards

          int numRBCards
          How many Road Building cards (SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS) this player has played.
          Since:
          2.4.50
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.getDevCardsPlayed(), SOCPlayer.updateDevCardsPlayed(int)

        • numDISCCards

          int numDISCCards
          How many Discovery/Year of Plenty cards (SOCDevCardConstants.DISC) this player has played.
          Since:
          2.4.50
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.getDevCardsPlayed(), SOCPlayer.updateDevCardsPlayed(int)

        • numMONOCards

          int numMONOCards
          How many Monopoly cards (SOCDevCardConstants.MONO) this player has played.
          Since:
          2.4.50
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.getDevCardsPlayed(), SOCPlayer.updateDevCardsPlayed(int)

        • buildingVP

          int buildingVP
          the number of victory points for settlements and cities

        • specialVP

          int specialVP
          The number of Special Victory Points (SVPs), which are awarded in certain game scenarios on the large sea board. Does not include VPs from SOCPlayer.numCloth, cloth is part of SOCPlayer.getTotalVP().

          When updating this value, if the SVP came from a piece, also set or check SOCPlayingPiece.specialVP and SOCPlayingPiece.specialVPEvent.

          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.svpInfo

        • svpInfo

          java.util.ArrayList<E> svpInfo
          The details behind the total SVP count in SOCPlayer.specialVP, or null if none. This is filled at the server (because it has the text strings) when SOCGame.gameEventListener != null, and sent out to clients.
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.addSpecialVPInfo(int, String)

        • finalTotalVP

          int finalTotalVP
          the final total score (pushed from server at end of game), or 0 if no score has been forced.
          Since:
          1.1.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.forceFinalVP(int)

        • numCloth

          int numCloth
          For some game scenarios, how many cloth does this player have? Every 2 pieces of cloth is worth 1 VP.
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.specialVP

        • needToDiscard

          boolean needToDiscard
          this flag is true if the player needs to discard and must pick which resources to lose.
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.needToPickGoldHexResources

        • needToPickGoldHexResources

          int needToPickGoldHexResources
          If nonzero, waiting for player to pick this many gold-hex resources, after a dice roll or placing their final initial settlement.

          When setting this field, also increment SOCPlayer.resourceStats [GOLD_LOCAL].

          Game state GameState.WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE or GameState.STARTS_WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE.

          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.needToDiscard

        • roadNodes

          java.util.Vector<E> roadNodes
          all of the nodes that this player's roads and ships touch; this is used to calculate longest road / longest trade route.
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.roadsAndShips, SOCPlayer.roadNodeGraph

        • roadNodeGraph

          java.util.Hashtable<K,V> roadNodeGraph
          A graph of what adjacent nodes are connected by this player's roads and ships. If roadNodeGraph[node1][node2], then a road or ship connects them; roadNodeGraph[node2][node1] will also be true.

          Implementation:
          Key = node1's coordinate Integer.
          Value = int[] array of length 3, for the 3 adjacent nodes.
          If an element of the array is 0, no connection. A non-zero element is node2's coordinate at the other end of the road connecting them.

          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.isConnectedByRoad(int, int)

        • legalRoads

          java.util.HashSet<E> legalRoads
          a list of edges where it is legal to place a road. an edge is legal if a road could eventually be placed there.

          If not SOCGame.hasSeaBoard, initialized in constructor from SOCBoard.initPlayerLegalRoads().

          If SOCGame.hasSeaBoard, empty until SOCBoard.makeNewBoard(SOCGameOptionSet) and SOCGame.startGame(), because the board layout and legal settlements vary from game to game.

        • legalSettlements

          java.util.HashSet<E> legalSettlements
          The set of nodes where it's legal to place a settlement; see SOCPlayer.getLegalSettlements() for details.
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.potentialSettlements, SOCBoard.nodesOnLand

        • addedLegalSettlement

          int addedLegalSettlement
          The most recently added node from SOCPlayer.addLegalSettlement(int, boolean), or 0.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • legalShips

          java.util.HashSet<E> legalShips
          a list of edges where it is legal to place a ship. an edge is legal if a ship could eventually be placed there.

          If the game doesn't use the large sea board (! SOCGame.hasSeaBoard), this set is empty but non-null.

          May be updated during game play by SOCPlayer.updateLegalShipsAddHex(int).

          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.legalShipsRestricted

        • legalShipsRestricted

          java.util.HashSet<E> legalShipsRestricted
          A list of edges if the legal sea edges for ships are restricted by the game's scenario (_SC_PIRI), or null if all sea edges are legal for ships. If the player has no legal ship edges, this list is empty (not null).

          This list, separate from SOCPlayer.legalShips, is necessary because some methods change legalShips by removing or adding edges.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • potentialRoads

          java.util.HashSet<E> potentialRoads
          a set of edges where a road could be placed on the next turn. At start of the game, this is clear/empty. Elements are set true when the player places adjacent settlements or roads, via SOCPlayer.updatePotentials(SOCPlayingPiece). Elements are set false when a road or ship is placed on their edge.

        • potentialSettlements

          java.util.HashSet<E> potentialSettlements
          a set of nodes where a settlement could be placed on the next turn. At start of the game, all SOCPlayer.legalSettlements are also potential. When the second settlement is placed, potentialSettlements is cleared, and then re-set via updatePotentials(SOCRoad). Placing a settlement will clear its node and adjacent nodes.

          Key = node coordinate, as Integer. If potentialSettlements.contains(Integer.valueOf(nodeCoord)), then this is a potential settlement.

          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.legalSettlements, SOCPlayer.setPotentialAndLegalSettlements(Collection, boolean, HashSet[]), SOCBoard.nodesOnLand

        • potentialCities

          java.util.HashSet<E> potentialCities
          a set of nodes where a city could be placed on the next turn. At start of the game, this is clear/empty because the player has no settlements yet. Elements are set true when the player places settlements, via SOCPlayer.updatePotentials(SOCPlayingPiece). Elements are set false when cities are placed. Unlike other piece types, there is no "legalCities" set, because we use SOCPlayer.legalSettlements before placing a settlement, and settlements can always become cities.

        • potentialShips

          java.util.HashSet<E> potentialShips
          a set of edges where a ship could be placed on the next turn. At start of the game, this is clear/empty. Elements are set true when the player places adjacent settlements or ships, via SOCPlayer.updatePotentials(SOCPlayingPiece). Elements are set false when a road or ship is placed on their edge.

          If the game doesn't use the large sea board (! SOCGame.hasSeaBoard), this set is empty but non-null.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • hasPotentialSettlesInitInFog

          boolean hasPotentialSettlesInitInFog
          True if board has fog hexes, SOCPlayer.potentialSettlements has some nodes on the fog hexes, and game hasn't completed SOCGame.isInitialPlacement() yet.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • ports

          boolean[] ports
          a boolean array stating wheather this player is touching a particular kind of port. Index == port type, in range SOCBoard.MISC_PORT to SOCBoard.WOOD_PORT

        • currentOffer

          SOCTradeOffer currentOffer
          this is the current trade offer that this player is making, or null if none
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.currentOfferTimeMillis

        • currentOfferTimeMillis

          long currentOfferTimeMillis
          time when SOCPlayer.currentOffer was last updated; see SOCPlayer.getCurrentOfferTime().
          Since:
          2.4.50

        • playedDevCard

          boolean playedDevCard
          this is true if the player played a development card this turn

        • boardResetAskedThisTurn

          boolean boardResetAskedThisTurn
          this is true if the player asked to reset the board this turn
          Since:
          1.1.00

        • askedSpecialBuild

          boolean askedSpecialBuild
          In 6-player mode, is the player asking to build during the Special Building Phase?
          Since:
          1.1.08
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.hasSpecialBuiltThisTurn

        • hasSpecialBuiltThisTurn

          boolean hasSpecialBuiltThisTurn
          In 6-player mode, has the player already built during the Special Building Phase?
          Since:
          1.1.09
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.askedSpecialBuild

        • playerEvents_bitmask

          int playerEvents_bitmask
          Track one-time player events for scenarios on the large sea board. As events occur during a game, each one's SOCPlayerEvent.flagValue bit is set here.

          Example events: SOCPlayerEvent.SVP_SETTLED_ANY_NEW_LANDAREA, SOCPlayerEvent.CLOTH_TRADE_ESTABLISHED_VILLAGE.

          Bits are kept here, not in separate boolean fields, to keep them together and send over the network. Not all player events are here; some can't be represented in a single flag bit, such as SOCPlayer.scenario_svpFromEachLandArea_bitmask.

          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayer.getPlayerEvents()

        • scenario_svpFromEachLandArea_bitmask

          int scenario_svpFromEachLandArea_bitmask
          For some scenarios on the large sea board, bitmask: true if the player has been given a Special Victory Point for placing a settlement in a given new land area. The bit value is (1 << (landAreaNumber - 1)).
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPlayerEvent.SVP_SETTLED_EACH_NEW_LANDAREA, SOCPlayer.playerEvents_bitmask, SOCPlayer.getScenarioSVPLandAreas()

        • startingLandArea1

          int startingLandArea1
          The land area(s) of the player's initial settlements, if SOCGame.hasSeaBoard and the board defines Land Areas (null != SOCBoardLarge.getLandAreasLegalNodes()). Used for Special Victory Points in some scenarios. 0 otherwise.

          If both initial settlements are in the same land area, then SOCPlayer.startingLandArea2 is 0.

          Also: If SOCBoardLarge.getStartingLandArea() != 0, the players must start in that land area. This is enforced at the server during makeNewBoard, by using that land area for the only initial potential/legal settlement locations.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • startingLandArea2

          int startingLandArea2
          The land area(s) of the player's initial settlements, if SOCGame.hasSeaBoard and the board defines Land Areas (null != SOCBoardLarge.getLandAreasLegalNodes()). Used for Special Victory Points in some scenarios. 0 otherwise.

          If both initial settlements are in the same land area, then SOCPlayer.startingLandArea2 is 0.

          Also: If SOCBoardLarge.getStartingLandArea() != 0, the players must start in that land area. This is enforced at the server during makeNewBoard, by using that land area for the only initial potential/legal settlement locations.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • robotFlag

          boolean robotFlag
          this is true if this player is a robot

        • builtInRobotFlag

          boolean builtInRobotFlag
          Is this robot connection the built-in robot (not a 3rd-party), with the original AI?
          Since:
          1.1.09
          See Also:
          SOCImARobot

        • faceId

          int faceId
          Which face image this player is using. See SOCPlayer.getFaceId() for details.

        • ourNumbers

          SOCPlayerNumbers ourNumbers
          the numbers that our settlements are touching

        • isTradeRouteFarEndClosed_foundVillage

          SOCVillage isTradeRouteFarEndClosed_foundVillage
          Set by SOCPlayer.isTradeRouteFarEndClosed(SOCShip, int, HashSet, List) if it finds a SOCVillage at any far end. Not set unless both SOCGame.hasSeaBoard and SOCGameOptionSet.K_SC_CLVI are set.
          Since:
          2.0.00

    • Class soc.game.SOCPlayingPiece extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2300L

      • Serialized Fields

        • pieceType

          int pieceType
          The type of this playing piece, within range SOCPlayingPiece.MIN to (SOCPlayingPiece.MAXPLUSONE - 1)

        • coord

          int coord
          Coordinates on the board for this piece. An edge or a node, depending on piece type.

        • specialVP

          int specialVP
          Special Victory Points (SVP) awarded for placing this piece, if any. Used with the large sea board game scenarios. When SOCPlayingPiece.specialVP != 0, the source is SOCPlayingPiece.specialVPEvent.

          When setting or incrementing this field, should also increment/add to player's specialVP field. Don't just increase player's SVP by the piece's new specialVP, because piece may have accumulated SVP from multiple events which are already part of player's SVP amount.

          Note: This is set when the piece was placed, so it's always accurate at server. At client it may be 0 if the client joined the game after this piece was placed.

          Since:
          2.0.00

          the number of each resource type. Indexes 1 to n are used: 1 == SOCResourceConstants.CLAY, 2 == SOCResourceConstants.ORE, ... 5 == SOCResourceConstants.WOOD, 6 == SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN.

    • Class soc.message.SOCAuthRequest extends SOCMessage implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2000L

      • Serialized Fields

        • role

          java.lang.String role
          Role that requester connected to server for, such as SOCAuthRequest.ROLE_GAME_PLAYER or SOCAuthRequest.ROLE_USER_ADMIN.

          This is an untrusted field that's here for convenience. Later messages will always check whether the authenticated user has authorization to (for example) create users. By sending SOCAuthRequest.ROLE_USER_ADMIN with this message instead of that later one, the server can tell a client at login that they aren't authorized instead of telling them only after they've filled out the account creation form.

        • nickname

          java.lang.String nickname
          Nickname (username) of the joining client

        • password

          java.lang.String password
          Optional password, or "". This is the last field of the message so it can contain delimiter chars.

        • authScheme

          int authScheme
          Authentication scheme number, such as SOCAuthRequest.SCHEME_CLIENT_PLAINTEXT.

        • host

          java.lang.String host
          Server host name to which the client is connecting, or null for client's local TCP server. Since the client is already connected when it sends the message, this is only informational. The empty string "" is stored as null here.

    • Class soc.message.SOCGameOptionGetInfos extends SOCMessage implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2000L

      • Serialized Fields

        • optionKeys

          java.util.List<E> optionKeys
          List of specific game option keynames to ask about, or null. Does not include SOCGameOptionGetInfos.OPTKEY_GET_I18N_DESCS, use SOCGameOptionGetInfos.hasTokenGetI18nDescs instead. At sending client, does include SOCGameOptionGetInfos.OPTKEY_GET_ANY_CHANGES if needed; receiving server uses SOCGameOptionGetInfos.hasTokenGetAnyChanges instead.

          If null, then "-" was sent unless SOCGameOptionGetInfos.hasOnlyTokenI18n.

          Before v2.0.00 this was private field optkeys, with public getter getOptionKeys().

        • hasTokenGetI18nDescs

          boolean hasTokenGetI18nDescs
          True if client is also asking server for localized game option descriptions (v2.0.00 and newer); will send SOCGameOptionGetInfos.OPTKEY_GET_I18N_DESCS along with SOCGameOptionGetInfos.optionKeys.
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCGameOptionGetInfos.hasOnlyTokenI18n, SOCGameOptionGetInfos.hasTokenGetAnyChanges

        • hasOnlyTokenI18n

          boolean hasOnlyTokenI18n
          True if client is same version as server, and is asking only for SOCGameOptionGetInfos.OPTKEY_GET_I18N_DESCS; will send SOCGameOptionGetInfos.OPTKEY_GET_I18N_DESCS as the sole "option key": "?I18N", not "-,?I18N". SOCGameOptionGetInfos.optionKeys must be null.
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCGameOptionGetInfos.hasTokenGetI18nDescs

        • hasTokenGetAnyChanges

          boolean hasTokenGetAnyChanges
          True if client sent SOCGameOptionGetInfos.OPTKEY_GET_ANY_CHANGES as part of SOCGameOptionGetInfos.optionKeys. During parsing at server, this flag was set and that token was removed from optionKeys.

          Because it's seldom used, unlike SOCGameOptionGetInfos.hasTokenGetI18nDescs, this flag isn't final or a constructor parameter.

          Since:
          2.4.50

    • Class soc.message.SOCInventoryItemAction extends SOCMessageForGame implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2000L

      • Serialized Fields

        • playerNumber

          int playerNumber
          Player number (or -1 for action SOCInventoryItemAction.CANNOT_PLAY) from server, or any value sent from client (not used by server)

        • itemType

          int itemType
          The item type code, from SOCInventoryItem.itype

        • action

          int action
          Action, such as SOCInventoryItemAction.ADD_PLAYABLE or SOCInventoryItemAction.PLAY

        • reasonCode

          int reasonCode
          Optional reason codes for the SOCInventoryItemAction.CANNOT_PLAY action, corresponding to SOCGame.canPlayInventoryItem(int, int) return codes, or 0. Also used within this class to encode SOCInventoryItemAction.isKept and SOCInventoryItemAction.isVP over the network.

        • isKept

          boolean isKept
          If true, this item being added is kept in inventory until end of game. This flag is sent for all actions except SOCInventoryItemAction.PLAY and SOCInventoryItemAction.CANNOT_PLAY.

        • isVP

          boolean isVP
          If true, this item being added is worth victory points. This flag is sent for all actions except SOCInventoryItemAction.PLAY and SOCInventoryItemAction.CANNOT_PLAY.

        • canCancelPlay

          boolean canCancelPlay
          If true when sent with any ADD action, this item's later play or placement can be canceled: SOCInventoryItem.canCancelPlay. This flag is sent for all actions except SOCInventoryItemAction.PLAY and SOCInventoryItemAction.CANNOT_PLAY.

    • Class soc.message.SOCPotentialSettlements extends SOCMessageForGame implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2000L

      • Serialized Fields

        • playerNumber

          int playerNumber
          Player number, or -1 for all players; see SOCPotentialSettlements.getPlayerNumber() for details.

        • psNodes

          java.util.List<E> psNodes
          Potential settlement node coordinates for SOCPotentialSettlements.playerNumber; see SOCPotentialSettlements.getPotentialSettlements(boolean) for details.

          Before v2.0.00 this field was psList.

          See Also:
          SOCPotentialSettlements.landAreasLegalNodes, SOCPotentialSettlements.psNodesFromAll

        • psNodesFromAll

          boolean psNodesFromAll
          True if SOCPotentialSettlements.startingLandArea == 0 and SOCPotentialSettlements.psNodes is merely the union of all node sets in SOCPotentialSettlements.landAreasLegalNodes. Example: Scenario SC_4ISL's board layouts.

          False otherwise, or if not applicable because SOCPotentialSettlements.areaCount == 1 and SOCPotentialSettlements.landAreasLegalNodes == null.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • areaCount

          int areaCount
          How many land areas are defined on this board. Always 1 in classic boards (before v2.0.00).
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • startingLandArea

          int startingLandArea
          Which land area number within SOCPotentialSettlements.landAreasLegalNodes contains SOCPotentialSettlements.psNodes? 0 if none because the game already started and psNodes is unique to the player. 0 if none when game is starting now and players can place anywhere.

          Not used if SOCPotentialSettlements.areaCount == 1.

          Since:
          2.0.00

        • landAreasLegalNodes

          java.util.HashSet<E>[] landAreasLegalNodes
          For sea boards, each land area's legal node coordinates. Index 0 is unused, not a Land Area number. All other indexes are non-null Sets.

          Null if SOCPotentialSettlements.areaCount == 1.

          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCPotentialSettlements.startingLandArea, SOCPotentialSettlements.psNodes

        • legalSeaEdges

          int[][] legalSeaEdges
          Optional field for legal sea edges per player for ships, if restricted. Usually null, because all sea edges are legal except in scenario _SC_PIRI.

          If SOCPotentialSettlements.playerNumber != -1, legalSeaEdges contains 1 array, the legal sea edges for that player. Otherwise contains 1 array for each player position (total 4 or 6 arrays).

          Each per-player array is the same format as in SOCBoardAtServer.PIR_ISL_SEA_EDGES: A list of individual sea edge coordinates and/or ranges. Ranges are designated by a pair of positive,negative numbers: 0xC04, -0xC0D is a range of the valid edges from C04 through C0D inclusive. If a player position is vacant, their subarray may be empty (length 0) or contain a single zero: { 0 }.

          Since:
          2.0.00

    • Class soc.message.SOCReportRobbery extends SOCMessageForGame implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2450L

      • Serialized Fields

        • victimPN

          int victimPN
          Victim player number, or -1 if none (for future use by scenarios/expansions)

        • perpPN

          int perpPN
          Perpetrator player number, or -1 if none (used by SC_PIRI scenario's pirate fleet attack results, future use by other scenarios/expansions)

        • resType

          int resType
          Resource type being stolen, like SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP or SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN. Ignored if SOCReportRobbery.resSet != null or SOCReportRobbery.peType != null.

        • resSet

          SOCResourceSet resSet
          Resource set being stolen, or null if what's being stolen is a single resource type like sheep or unknown (use SOCReportRobbery.resType instead) or a SOCReportRobbery.peType. Should not be empty or contain SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN resources.

        • peType

          SOCPlayerElement.PEType peType
          PlayerElement type such as SOCPlayerElement.PEType.SCENARIO_CLOTH_COUNT, or null if what's being stolen is a SOCReportRobbery.resSet or a single resource type like sheep (use SOCReportRobbery.resType instead).

        • isGainLose

          boolean isGainLose
          True if SOCReportRobbery.amount is gained by SOCReportRobbery.perpPN and lost by SOCReportRobbery.victimPN, false if SOCReportRobbery.amount and SOCReportRobbery.victimAmount are their new total amounts to set.

          Always true if SOCReportRobbery.resSet != null, which doesn't use amount and victimAmount fields.

        • amount

          int amount
          Amount stolen if SOCReportRobbery.isGainLose, or SOCReportRobbery.perpPN's new total amount (see SOCReportRobbery.victimAmount). Ignored if SOCReportRobbery.resSet != null.

        • victimAmount

          int victimAmount
          SOCReportRobbery.victimPN's new total amount if not SOCReportRobbery.isGainLose (see SOCReportRobbery.amount); unsent (0) if SOCReportRobbery.isGainLose. Ignored if SOCReportRobbery.resSet != null.

        • extraValue

          int extraValue
          Optional information related to the robbery, or 0; for use by scenarios/expansions. Used in scenario SC_PIRI to send the pirate fleet strength when they attack (see class javadoc).

      serialVersionUID:
      2450L

      • Serialized Fields

        • scen

          SOCScenario scen
          Parsed scenario from server (SOCScenarioInfo.getScenario()), or null if SOCScenarioInfo.isKeyUnknown or SOCScenarioInfo.noMoreScens or if this message is from client to server. When null, see field SOCScenarioInfo.scKey for scenario name.

          Before v2.4.50, this field was sc.

          java.lang.String scKey

        • isKeyUnknown

          boolean isKeyUnknown
          If true, this requested SOCScenarioInfo.getScenarioKey() is unknown; used in reply from server to client. This can occur if the client's version is newer than the server. A message with this flag set will have null SOCScenarioInfo.getScenario().

          boolean noMoreScens
          If true, there are no more scenarios to send; used in reply from server to client. A message with this flag set will have null SOCScenarioInfo.getScenario().

          int op

          Optional level of construction or strength, or 0.

    • Class soc.robot.SOCPossiblePiece extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      2450L

      • Serialized Fields

        • pieceType

          int pieceType
          The type of this playing piece; a constant such as SOCPossiblePiece.ROAD, SOCPossiblePiece.CITY, etc. The constant types are the same as in SOCPlayingPiece.getResourcesToBuild(int).

        • coord

          int coord
          Where this piece is on the board. Some piece types such as SOCPossiblePiece.CARD do not use this field, it will be 0 if unused. In some board layouts 0 is a valid coordinate; check the piece type to determine if unused.

        • eta

          int eta
          this is how soon we estimate we can build this piece measured in turns (ETA)

        • updated

          boolean updated
          this is a flag used for updating

        • score

          float score
          this is a score used for deciding what to build next

        • biggestThreats

          java.util.ArrayList<E> biggestThreats
          this is the piece that we need to beat to build this one

        • threats

          java.util.ArrayList<E> threats
          pieces that threaten this piece

        • threatUpdatedFlag

          boolean threatUpdatedFlag
          this flag is used for threat updating

        • hasBeenExpanded

          boolean hasBeenExpanded
          this flag is used for expansion

    • Class soc.server.SOCServer extends Server implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • rand

          java.util.Random rand
          So we can get random numbers.

        • maxConnections

          int maxConnections
          Maximum number of connections allowed. Remember that robots count against this limit. Set with SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_CONNECTIONS.

        • allowDebugUser

          boolean allowDebugUser
          Is a debug user enabled and allowed to run the commands listed in SOCServer.DEBUG_COMMANDS_HELP? Default is false. Set with SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_ALLOW_DEBUG.

          Note that all practice games are debug mode, for ease of debugging; to determine this, SOCServerMessageHandler.handleGAMETEXTMSG(Connection, SOCGameTextMsg) checks if the client is using MemConnection to talk to the server.

          Publicly visible via SOCServer.isDebugUserEnabled().

          Since:
          1.1.14
          See Also:
          SOCServer.processDebugCommand(Connection, SOCGame, String, String)

        • hasUtilityModeProp

          boolean hasUtilityModeProp
          True if Server.props contains a property which is used to run the server in Utility Mode instead of Server Mode. In Utility Mode the server reads its properties, initializes its database connection if any, and performs one task such as a password reset or table/index creation. It won't start other threads and won't fail startup if TCP port binding fails.

          For a list of Utility Mode properties, see SOCServer.hasUtilityModeProperty().

          This flag is set early in SOCServer.initSocServer(String, String); if you add a property which sets Utility Mode, update that code.

          Since:
          1.1.20
          See Also:
          SOCServer.utilityModeMessage

        • utilityModeMessage

          java.lang.String utilityModeMessage
          If SOCServer.hasUtilityModeProp, an optional status message to print before exiting, or null.
          Since:
          1.1.20

        • db

          SOCDBHelper db
          Database helper; non-null after construction, which calls SOCServer.initSocServer(String, String), even if no DB is configured. Call SOCDBHelper.isInitialized() to see if actually connected.

          Before v2.4.50, SOCDBHelper methods were static and this field wasn't needed.

          Since:
          2.4.50

        • knownOpts

          SOCGameOptionSet knownOpts
          All the Known Game Options at this server, copied early from SOCServer.startupKnownOpts using field initializer.

          Before v2.4.50, SOCGameOption relied on an internal static map and this field wasn't needed.

          Since:
          2.4.50
          See Also:
          SOCServer.activateKnownOption(String)

        • features

          SOCFeatureSet features
          Active optional server features, if any; see SOCFeatureSet constants for currently defined features. Features are activated through the command line or Server.props.
          Since:
          1.1.19

        • has3rdPartyGameopts

          boolean has3rdPartyGameopts
          True if server has any known game options with SOCGameOption.FLAG_3RD_PARTY active. Those typically require an accompanying client feature, which means all clients should be treated as if their SOCClientData.hasLimitedFeats flag is set.
          Since:
          2.4.50
          See Also:
          SOCServer.PROP_JVM_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_SERVER_GAMEOPT3P

        • handler

          SOCGameHandler handler
          Game type handler, currently shared by all game instances. Includes a SOCGameMessageHandler.
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCServer.srvMsgHandler

        • acctsNotOpenRegButNoUsers

          boolean acctsNotOpenRegButNoUsers
          Server internal flag to indicate that user accounts are active, and authentication is required to create accounts, and there aren't any accounts in the database yet. (Server's active features include SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_ACCOUNTS but not SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_OPEN_REG.) This flag is set at startup, instead of querying SOCDBHelper.countUsers() every time a client connects.

          Used for signaling to SOCAccountClient that it shouldn't ask for a password when connecting to create the first account, by sending the client SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_OPEN_REG along with the actually active features.

          The first successful account creation will clear this flag.

          SOCServer.createAccount(String, String, String, Connection) does call countUsers() and requires auth if any account exists, even if this flag is set.

          Since:
          1.1.19

        • srvShutPassword

          java.lang.String srvShutPassword
          JM temp - generated password to allow clean server shutdown. Must be used before SOCServer.srvShutPasswordExpire.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • srvShutPasswordExpire

          long srvShutPasswordExpire
          JM temp - expiration of SOCServer.srvShutPassword.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • robotCookie

          java.lang.String robotCookie
          Randomly generated cookie string required for robot clients to connect and identify as bots using SOCImARobot. It isn't sent encrypted and is a weak "shared secret". Generated in SOCServer.generateRobotCookie() unless the server is given SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_COOKIE at startup, which can set it to any string or to null if the property is empty.

          The value must pass SOCMessage.isSingleLineAndSafe(String): Must not contain the '|' or ',' characters.

          Since:
          1.1.19

        • robots

          java.util.Vector<E> robots
          A list of all robot client Connections connected to this server. Includes built-in bots and any third-party bots (which are also in SOCServer.robots3p).
          See Also:
          SOCLocalRobotClient.robotClients

        • robots3p

          java.util.Vector<E> robots3p
          A list of third-party bot clients connected to this server, if any. A subset of SOCServer.robots (which also includes built-in bots). Third-party bot clients' SOCClientData.robot3rdPartyBrainClass != null.

          Locking: Adding or removing from this list should synchronize on SOCServer.robots to keep the two lists in sync.

          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCServer.robots3pCliConstrucs

        • robots3pCliConstrucs

          java.util.List<E> robots3pCliConstrucs
          A list of third-party bot clients started up by server like the built-in bots, or null if none. Initialized during server startup by parsing property from SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_START3P. Used in SOCServer.setupLocalRobots(int, int).
          Since:
          2.2.00
          See Also:
          SOCServer.robots3p

        • limitedConns

          java.util.HashSet<E> limitedConns
          The limited-feature clients' connections: Those with the SOCClientData.hasLimitedFeats flag set. These may be named or unnamed.
          Locks: All adding/removing of connections synchronizes on Server.unnamedConns.
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          Server.conns, Server.unnamedConns

        • savegameDir

          java.io.File savegameDir
          Directory in which to save/load game files, from SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_SAVEGAME_DIR, or null. Not used if SOCServer.savegameInitFailed. If not SOCServer.allowDebugUser, will be null.
          Since:
          2.3.00

        • savegameInitFailed

          boolean savegameInitFailed
          If true, initSocServer tried to set up SOCServer.savegameDir and the classes it relies on, but failed. A warning was printed to console. SOCServer.savegameDir may be non-null.
          Since:
          2.3.00

        • channelList

          SOCChannelList channelList
          list of chat channels

          Instead of calling SOCChannelList.deleteChannel(String), call SOCServer.destroyChannel(String) to also clean up related server data.

        • gameList

          SOCGameListAtServer gameList
          list of soc games

        • srvMsgHandler

          SOCServerMessageHandler srvMsgHandler
          Server message handler to process inbound messages from clients. Messages related to actions in specific games are instead processed by SOCGameMessageHandler.
          Since:
          2.0.00
          See Also:
          SOCServer.handler

        • robotJoinRequests

          java.util.Hashtable<K,V> robotJoinRequests
          Holds current requests for robots to join games:
          Key = Game name, value = Synchronized Hashtable with requested bot Connections and arbitrary related data; SOCGameHandler stores the bot's in-game seat number there as an Integer.

          Before v2.0.00 the per-game value was a Vector<Connection> without per-bot related data.

          See Also:
          SOCServer.readyGameAskRobotsJoin(SOCGame, boolean[], Connection[], int), SOCServer.leaveConnection(Connection), GameHandler.findRobotAskJoinGame(SOCGame, Object, boolean), SOCServer.robotDismissRequests

        • robotDismissRequests

          java.util.Hashtable<K,V> robotDismissRequests
          table of requests for robots to leave games
          See Also:
          SOCServer.robotJoinRequests

        • startTime

          long startTime
          the time that this server was started

        • numberOfGamesStarted

          int numberOfGamesStarted
          The total number of games that have been started: GameHandler.startGame(SOCGame) has been called and game play has begun. Game state became GameState.READY or higher from an earlier/lower state.

        • numberOfGamesFinished

          int numberOfGamesFinished
          The total number of games finished: Game state became GameState.GAME_OVER or higher from an earlier/lower state. Incremented in SOCServer.gameOverIncrGamesFinishedCount(SOCGame).

          Before v1.1.20 this was the number of games destroyed, and *STATS* wouldn't reflect a newly finished game until all players had left that game.

          See Also:
          SOCServer.numberOfGamesFinishedWithBots

        • numberOfGamesFinishedWithBots

          int numberOfGamesFinishedWithBots
          The total number of games finished which had at least 1 robot at the end of the game. See SOCServer.numberOfGamesFinished for details.
          Since:
          2.3.00
          See Also:
          SOCServer.numberOfGamesFinished, SOCServer.numberOfBotsInFinishedGames

        • numberOfBotsInFinishedGames

          int numberOfBotsInFinishedGames
          Total number of bots who were in SOCServer.numberOfGamesFinishedWithBots at the end of those games. Updated in SOCServer.gameOverIncrGamesFinishedCount(SOCGame).
          Since:
          2.3.00

        • countFieldSync

          java.lang.Object countFieldSync
          Synchronization for SOCServer.numberOfGamesFinished writes, along with related fields like SOCServer.numberOfBotsInFinishedGames.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • numberOfUsers

          int numberOfUsers
          total number of users

        • clientPastVersionStats

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> clientPastVersionStats
          Client version count stats since startup (includes bots). Key = version number, Value = client count. Incremented from SOCServer.setClientVersSendGamesOrReject(Connection, int, String, String, boolean). Must synchronize on the map when modifying its contents.
          Since:
          1.1.19

        • numRobotOnlyGamesRemaining

          int numRobotOnlyGamesRemaining
          Number of robot-only games not yet started (optional feature). Set at startup from SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_BOTS_BOTGAMES_TOTAL, then counts down to 0 as games are played: See SOCServer.startRobotOnlyGames(boolean, boolean).
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • replyAuthTimer

          java.util.Timer replyAuthTimer
          Timer for delaying auth replies for consistency with BCrypt timing. Used when ! hadDelay in authResult(String, boolean) callbacks.
          Since:
          1.2.00

        • miscTaskTimer

          java.util.Timer miscTaskTimer
          Timer to queue and soon run miscellaneous short-duration Runnable tasks without tying up any single-threaded part of the server.
          Since:
          2.0.00

        • serverRobotPinger

          SOCServerRobotPinger serverRobotPinger
          server robot pinger

        • gameTimeoutChecker

          SOCGameTimeoutChecker gameTimeoutChecker
          Game timeout and and turn timeout checker. Forces end of turn if a robot is too slow to act. See its class javadoc and SOCForceEndTurnThread.

        • databaseUserName

          java.lang.String databaseUserName

        • databasePassword

          java.lang.String databasePassword

        • databaseUserAdmins

          java.util.Set<E> databaseUserAdmins
          User admins list, from SOCServer.PROP_JSETTLERS_ACCOUNTS_ADMINS, or null if not specified. Unless SOCFeatureSet.SERVER_OPEN_REG is active, only usernames on this list can create user accounts in SOCServer.createAccount(String, String, String, Connection).

          If DB schema >= SOCDBHelper.SCHEMA_VERSION_1200, this list is made lowercase for case-insensitive checks in SOCServer.isUserDBUserAdmin(String).

          Before v1.2.00, if this was null any authenticated user could create other accounts.

          Since:
          1.1.19

        • connNames

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> connNames
          Map for case-insensitive lookup of connection names in Server.conns.

          Key: c.getData() .toLowerCase(Locale.US).
          Value: c.getData() with its actual case

          Locks: Adding/removing/naming/versioning of connections synchronizes on Server.unnamedConns.

          Since:
          1.2.00

        • multiplexQueue

          InboundMessageQueue multiplexQueue
          The queue of messages received from all clients to dispatch, and/or Runnable tasks to run, in the Treater thread which calls SOCMessageDispatcher.dispatch(SOCMessage, Connection).

          Before v2.0.00, this was a Vector.

        • cliVersionsConnected

          java.util.TreeMap<K,V> cliVersionsConnected
          Versions of currently connected clients, according to Connection.getRemoteVersion(). Key = Integer(version). Value = ConnVersionCounter. Synchronized on Server.unnamedConns, like many other client-related structures.
          Since:
          1.1.06
          See Also:
          Server.clientVersionAdd(int), Server.clientVersionRem(int)

        • cliVersionMin

          int cliVersionMin
          Minimum and maximum client version currently connected. Meaningless if Server.numberOfConnections is 0.
          Since:
          1.1.06
          See Also:
          Server.cliVersionsConnected

        • cliVersionMax

          int cliVersionMax
          Minimum and maximum client version currently connected. Meaningless if Server.numberOfConnections is 0.
          Since:
          1.1.06
          See Also:
          Server.cliVersionsConnected

        • cliVersionsConnectedQuickCheckCount

          int cliVersionsConnectedQuickCheckCount
          For Server.cliVersionsConnected, the count of "quick" consistency-checks since the last full check.
          Since:
          1.1.06

        • utilTimer

          java.util.Timer utilTimer
          Timer for scheduling timed/recurring tasks.
          Since:
          1.1.06

        • cliConnDisconPrintsPending

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> cliConnDisconPrintsPending
          Client disconnect error messages, to be printed after a short delay by Server.ConnExcepDelayedPrintTask. If the client reconnects during the delay, the disconnect and reconnect messages are not printed, so long as your app removes them. This is only used if D.ebugIsEnabled() is true.

          Keys: The Connection object is used as the key within Server.addConnection(Connection) (for the rejoining message). The connection keyname is used as the key within Server.removeConnection(Connection, boolean) (for the leaving message); if this is null, the message is printed immediately and not added to this map.
          Values: A Server.ConnExcepDelayedPrintTask which will print the rejoining or leaving message after a delay.

          After your app (which extends Server) determines that a connection is the same client that just disconnected, it should find both of the tasks in this HashMap, call TimerTask.cancel() on them, and remove them.

          Since:
          1.1.07
          See Also:
          Server.CLI_DISCON_PRINT_TIMER_FIRE_MS
